com.xhive.query.interfaces
Class XhiveXQueryParam

java.lang.Object
  com.xhive.query.interfaces.XhiveXQueryParam
Deprecated. The usage of this class is deprecated in favor of XhiveXQueryQueryIf.setVariable(String, boolean) et al. Use XhiveNodeIf.createXQuery(String) to obtain a XhiveXQueryQueryIf. 

@Deprecated
public class XhiveXQueryParam
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents an external variable for XQuery queries. An external variable can be either an atomic value or a sequence.

Example usage: 

   XhiveLibraryIf lib = ...;
   String idString = ...;
   XhiveXQueryParam[] parameters = { new XhiveXQueryParam("idParam", idString) };
   lib.executeXQuery(
     "declare variable $idParam external; /root[@id = $idParam]",
     parameters);
You cannot reuse instances of this class. Instead, create a new instance for each call to the executeXQuery method.

XhiveXQueryParam

public XhiveXQueryParam(java.lang.String localname,
                        java.util.Iterator sequence)
Deprecated. 
Create a sequence parameter. For permissible types of the objects returned by the iterator and the associated XQuery types, see XhiveXQueryExtensionFunctionIf.call(java.util.Iterator[]).

Parameters:
localname - The name of the parameter as declared in the query.
sequence - The value of the parameter.

getSequence

public java.util.Iterator getSequence()
Deprecated. 
For internal use. Retrieve the value of the parameter. This does not create a new iterator, so this method can only be used once for each instance of this class.
